#bitcoin-core-dev Meeting: abubakarsadiq achow101 _aj_ ajonas b10c brunoerg cfields darosior dergoegge dzxzg eugenesiegel fanquake fjahr furszy gleb glozow hebasto hodlinator instagibbs janb84 jarolrod jonatack josibake kanzure kevkevin laanwj LarryRuane lightlike l0rinc luke-jr maflcko marcofleon maxedw Murch pinheadmz provoostenator ryanofsky sdaftuar S3RK stickies-v sipa sliv3r__ sr_gi tdb3 theStack TheCharlatan vasild

hi
There are no pre-proposed meeting topics this week. Any last minute ones to add?
hi
hi
hi
hi
hi
hi
Ok, let's start with WGs
#topic Cluster Mempool WG Update (sdaftuar, sipa)
I have closed #30289. Sadly, that also means dissolving the cluster mempool WG.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30289 | Cluster mempool tracking issue · Issue #30289 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
hi
hi
RIP!
Thanks everyone for getting us this far.
that's it :)
hi
Congrats on getting this far and thanks!
#topic Kernel WG Update (sedited)
well fought project, congrats
congrats sipa!
another RFC PR for improving blockmap and cchain concurrency was opened in #34654
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/34654 | [RFC] `BlockMap` and `CChain` Concurrency Improvement by alexanderwiederin · Pull Request #34654 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
just over 3 years since sdaftuar and I started talking about it :)
that's all from me.
#topic Benchmarking WG Update (l0rinc, andrewtoth)
#34165 was merged, thanks everyone!
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/34165 | coins: don't mutate main cache when connecting block by andrewtoth · Pull Request #34165 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
I rebased #31132 for that as well as furszy's ThreadPool. I'm hopeful we can merge that soon after v31 branch off
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31132 | validation: fetch block inputs on parallel threads 3x faster IBD by andrewtoth · Pull Request #31132 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
Not sure if l0rinc is here, but he opened #34641 after last week's meeting. Would be nice to get that in for v31
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/34641 | node: scale `-dbcache` default from total system RAM by l0rinc · Pull Request #34641 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
that's it from me
I think if we want to get that in for 31, we want to try and stem the scope creep there
fanquake: i just left some comments to that effect
Trying to do stuff like detecting containerisation, is too much, for what could be a one-liner change plus release notes
fair feedback
Not seeing any of the other WGs present. Anything else to discuss?
but i think it's worthwhile, absent 31132, it's a very simple and probably very practically beneficial improvement for many users
sipa: indeed
fjahr: theuni said he'd be away, but no update
fanquake: thanks

I'd like to add that, marcofleon opened an RFC issue for conceptual Erlay discussion (#34542) after it was brought up here a couple of weeks ago. Some people have contributted really valuable feedback, but I'd like others to also chime in :)
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/34542 | RFC: Erlay Conceptual Discussion · Issue #34542 · bitcoin/bitcoin · GitHub
I'd like to encourage others*
sr_gi: thanks!
